gurmukhi: ਭੲੀ ਰਿਖ ਰਾਮੰ ਬਡੀ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਚਰਚਾ || ਕਹੋ ਸਰਬ ਜੌਪੈ ਬਢੈ ੲੇਕ ਗ੍ਰੰਥਾ ||
transliteration: Bhairidh Raamannd Badigiaan Charchaa|| Kaho Sarab Jaoupai Badhai Ek Granthaa||
translation: Great discussions pertaining to divine knowledge were held between the sages and ram and if all of it is described, this granth (book) will become voluminous.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਦਾ ਬਿੱਪ ਕੀਨੇ ਘਨੀ ਦੱਛਨਾ ਦੈ || ਚਲੇ ਦੇਸ ਦੇਸੰ ਮਹਾਂ ਚਿੱਤ ਹਰਖੰ ||੬੯੮||
transliteration: Bidaa Bipp Keene Ghanidachchhnaa Dai|| Chale Des Desan Mahaan Chitt Harakhannd||698||
translation: All the sages were bestowed with suitable presents on bidding farewell to them who went away to their places happily.698.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਹੀ ਬੀਚ ਅਾਯੋ ਮ੍ਰਿਤੰ ਸੂਨ ਬਿੱਪੰ || ਜੀਅੈ ਬਾਲ ਅਾਜੈ ਨਹੀ ਤੋਹਿ ਸ੍ਰਾਪੰ ||
transliteration: Ehibeech Aayo Mritan Soon Bippan|| Jeeai Baaj Aajai Nahitoh(i) Sraapan||
translation: During this period a sage came with the corpse of his dead son and said to Ram, “If my child is not revived, I shall curse you.”

gurmukhi: ਸਭੈ ਰਾਮ ਜਾਨੀ ਚਿਤੰ ਤਾਹਿ ਬਾਤਾ || ਦਿਸੰ ਬਾਰਣੀ ਤੇ ਬਿਬਾਣੰ ਹਕਾਰਯੋ ||੬੯੯||
transliteration: Sabhai Raam Jaanicheetan Taah(i) Baataa|| Disan Baarnite Bibaanan Hakdaryo||699||
translation: Ram ruminated about it in his mind and started towards the westerly direction in his air-vehicle.699.

gurmukhi: ਹੁਤੋ ੲੇਕ ਸੂਦ੍ਰੰ ਦਿਸਾ ੳੁਤ੍ਰ ਮੱਧੰ || ਝੁਲੈ ਕੂਪ ਮੱਧੰ ਪਰਯੋ ਅੌਧ ਮੁੱਖੰ ||
transliteration: Houto Ek Soodran Disaa Outra Maddhan|| Jhulai Koop Maddhan Daryo Audh Moukkhan||
translation: In the north-western direction a Shudra was hanging overturned in a well;

gurmukhi: ਮਹਾਂ ੳੁਗ੍ਰ ਤੇ ਜਾਪ ਪਸਯਾਤ ੳੁਗ੍ਰੰ || ਹਨਯੋ ਤਾਹਿ ਰਾਮੰ ਅਸੰ ਅਾਪ ਹੱਥੰ ||੭੦੦||
transliteration: Mahaan Ougra Te Jaap Payaat Ougran|| Hanyo Taah(i) Raamannd Asan Aap Hatthan||700||
translation: He was performing a penance; Ram killed him with his own hand.700.

gurmukhi: ਜੀਯੋ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਪੁਤ੍ਰੰ ਹਰਯੋ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਸੋਗੰ || ਬਢੀ ਕੀਰਤ ਰਾਮੰ ਚਤੁਰ ਕੁੰਟ ਮੱਧੰ ||
transliteration: Jeeyo Brahm Poutran Daryo Brahm Sogadg|| Adhikeerat Raamannd Chatur Kount Maddhan||
translation: The son of Brahmin regained his life and his agony ended. The praise of Ram spread in all the four directions.

gurmukhi: ਕਰਯੋ ਦਸ ਸਹੰਸ੍ਰ ਲੳੁ ਰਾਜ ਅੳੁਧੰ || ਫਿਰੀ ਚਕ੍ਰ ਚਾਰੋ ਬਿਖੈ ਰਾਮ ਦੋਹੀ ||੭੦੧||
transliteration: Daryo Das Sahansra Lau Raaj Audhan|| Phiricharka Chdaro Bikhai Raam Dohee||701||
translation: In this way Ram was eulogized all over and the ruled over his kingdom for ten thousand years.701.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਣੇ ਦੇਸ ਦੇਸੰ ਨਰੇਸੰ ਤ ਰਾਮੰ || ਮਹਾਂ ਜੁੱਧ ਜੇਤਾ ਤਿਹੂੰ ਲੋਕ ਜਾਨਯੋ ||
transliteration: Jine Des Desan Daresan Ta Raamannd|| Mahaan Juddh Jetaa Tihoon Lok Jaanyo||
translation: Ram conquered the kings of various countries and he was considered a great conqueror in the three worlds.

gurmukhi: ਦਯੋ ਮੰਤ੍ਰੀ ਅੱਤ੍ਰੰ ਮਹਾਭ੍ਰਾਤ ਭਰਥੰ || ਕੀਯੋ ਸੈਨ ਨਾਥੰ ਸੁਮਿਤ੍ਰਾ ਕੁਮਾਰੰ ||੭੦੨||
transliteration: Dayo Mantriattran Mahaabhraat Bharathan|| Keeyo Sain Naathan Soumitraa Koumaaran||702||
translation: He made Bharat his ministers and made Lakshman and Shatrughan, the sons of Sumitra, his generals.702.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਮਤਿ ਮਹਾ ਰਿਖ ਰਘੁਬਰ || ਦੁੰਦਭ ਬਾਜਤਿ ਦਰ ਦਰ ||
transliteration: Soumat(i) Mahaa Rikh Raghoubar|| Doundabb Baajat(i) Dar Dar||
translation: The drum is resounding on the door of the great sage Raghuvir (Ram),

gurmukhi: ਜਗ ਕੀਅਸ ਧੁਨ ਘਰ ਬਰ || ਪੂਰ ਰਹੀ ਧੁਨ ਸੁਰਪੁਰ ||੭੦੩||
transliteration: Jag Keeas Dhoun Ghar Bar|| Poor Rahidhoun Surpur||703||
translation: And in the whole world, in all houses and in the abode of gods, he was hailed.703.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਢਰ ਮਹਾ ਰਘੁਨੰਦਨ || ਜਗਪਤ ਮੁਨ ਗਨ ਬੰਦਨ ||
transliteration: Sudhar Mahaa Raghounandan|| Jagpat Mounndgad Bandan||
translation: Being known with the name of Raghunandan, ram is the lord os the world and is worshipped by the sages..
